PUBLIC BULLETIN: Legal Aid services are provided at the Courthouse at 251-1355 Water St and 210-347 Leon Ave, Kelowna
Office Phone: Duty Counsel Office:  250.763.8613Legal Aid Society Applications:  1.866.577.2525Legal Aid Society General Inquiries Only:  1.604.601.6000
Service Details: - Offers a range of free services- Gives priority to people with low incomes, but many services are available to all residents of BC- Information provided by: our Aboriginal website, Family Law In BC website, intake assistants, publications, and in some communities, legal information outreach workers and Aboriginal community legal workers- Offers advice from duty counsel lawyers, or family advice lawyers- Offers representation if you qualify and have serious family problems, child protection matters, some immigration, mental health and prison law issues- Offers mediation services for family law matters through Mediation Referral pilot program
Hours: Mon-Fri, 9:00am - 11:00am  and 1:00pm - 3:30pm (210-347 Leon Ave Office)Mon-Thu: 9:00am -11:00am  and 1:00pm - 3:30pm (Kelowna Law Courts, 251-1355 Water St)
How to Apply: Apply in person to the Legal Aid Office in Kelowna or phone the Call Centre
Address & Map: 347 Leon Ave, Ste 210Kelowna, BC     V1Y 8C7View MapQuest Map
